info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 8:07AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR RAPID REDUCTIONS OF VISIBILITIES AND INTENSE SNOWFALL THIS MORNING... WEATHER... * Snow showers will impact the area this morning. * A dusting of snow can be expected within a very short time during some of the more intense snow showers. * Southwest winds around 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. * Air temperatures will range between 22 and 28 degrees. IMPACTS... * Visibilities will be a quarter mile or less at times due to Heavy Snow showers. Rapid fluctuations of visibility will occur. * Minor snow accumulations may lead to slippery roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * The combination of Heavy Snow and strong winds will result in localized white out conditions. Reduced visibilities along with snow covered and slippery roads will cause variable traffic rates throughout the county. Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
